This film was the perfect combination of everything you could want in a Godzilla film. It had memorable characters, good CGI, an interesting plot, fun moments, and an authentic representation of real Japanese tragedy. It took me a while to understand the timeline of the movie at the beginning, but once I got settled it was absolutely phenomenal.
So good. it's amazing and it truly made me cry

Absolutely fan-damn-tastic! I went in expecting a lot and got more than I expected. It's hard to find a Godzilla picture with a great story, but this one delivers, great writing and directing, I'm giving away nothing, best movie of the year by far, you will not be disappointed.
Going on my list of one of the best war movies ever made. A beautifully executed metaphor of post WW2 Japan, this is a about a lot more than Kaiju.

Was an okay film, maybe a genre/type I'm just not too keen on. Ending was good but I found myself not caring enough throughout, maybe not into Japanese acting. Movie looks really good given the tiny budget. A rated R would have made this a 3.5 stars
This is Toho Studios best Godzilla film ever made. Great human story, great acting the baddest, coolest Godzilla on screen. A definite must see!

Godzilla Minus One is the perfect starter movie to introduce you to the Godzilla universe. This artful, moving, yet digestible movie is simple enough for viewers of all ages to enjoy. For its $15 Million budget, this movie's effects look phenomenal, and Marvel should take notes! As for the story and themes, I didn't expect it to be so well-rounded and so much more than just the Godzilla monster. The portrayal of survivors' guilt is gut-wrenchingly realistic, and the grief the characters experience is painful to watch (in the best way). This movie brings a much more human perspective to the Godzilla phenomenon. This is the first Godzilla movie of any kind that I've seen in its entirety, and if all Godzilla movies are as good as this one was, I better start watching ASAP!
Absolutely outstanding film.  Wonderful screenplay, outstanding acting and overall great story.  I had goosebumps leaving the theater.
Classic monster movie gold
Total surprise! Well made

wow.  action, romance, tragic heroes, redemption... and a cliff hanger.  

a MUCH deeper movie than any of the current Godzilla/Kong flix.   Don't get me wrong - they're good too but this one is seriously Oscar worthy!

Great entertainment with some surprises regarding post WWII conditions in Japan, commentary on Japanese culture and societal expectations, acknowledgement of PTSD and more. Godzilla looks great, action scenes deliver and acting raises the bar ... on Godzilla movies : ) Compliments to TOHO for a welcome addition to the franchise!
Film was great. Has a film festival vibe. This movie gives a lot of energy towards the 1950s classic. I was moved.
Absolutely stunning monster movie bringing back the original creation.  It was a joy to watch with a love story running in parallel.  Godzilla is the all time best!
Best Godzilla yet! Awesome directing and great focus on the human fight for survival!
One of the best movies i have ever watchex

This is hands down one of the best movies I've ever seen. It's a perfect showcase of the indomitable human spirit and brought me to tears on more than one occasion. I felt immersed in the film in a way I previously didn't think was possible from a Godzilla movie. A must watch in my opinion.
Finally, a Godzilla movie I liked with characters that I actually cared about.

An outstanding and memorable addition to the Toho Godzilla legacy. Compelling characters, a tense, nail-biter plot, and special effects far beyond its $15M budget make this a must watch. G Fans and people who know nothing about Godzilla alike will love this film. Intense action and serious adult themes of wartime trauma mean this one isn't for young kids, but it will be a long-lasting favorite for years to come. Absolutely one of the best movies of the year, if not the decade.
Wow! Not what I was expecting, but it’s  masterful.!

movie exceeded my expectations. the scenes with godzilla were horrifying and stellar. he never overstayed his welcome. the narrative really pushed you to care about the characters and get invested. havent been emotional about a movie in a very long time. would reccomend
An amazing original film!
Easily the movie of the year.

Godzilla Minus One is the best monster movie of all time. Solid plot and take-home message. Godzilla was terrifyingly fantastic as a villain, I felt myself deeply rooting against him for the first time of my life. I typically like to see more monster, less people, but it was not the case for this film. Outstanding.

Movie did not show enough Godzilla for me majority of the movie spent on dialog of family  I was hoping the finale would at least be a long battle showing him at one point he let out  his Godzilla scream that was silent
By far the best Godzilla film!
Amazing movie I throughly enjoyed from bringing to end. I couldn’t have asked for a better movie. Thank you.
It’s great, made me cry.
Best movie in years!
The best Godzilla movie and definitely movie of the year.
Fantastic kaiju eiga. Great for all audience tastes.
Best movie of 2023! It's a must watch for monster fans
Enjoyed feeling like you were there with Godzilla and the usual excitement when the battles take place.

I was hesitant to see this in a theater due to the subtitles. I'm so glad I did as the subtitles didn't distract me at all. This has a moving storyline and a wonderful cast of characters that kept me engaged. The cinematography is spectacular, and the special effects are on point. The weaving of the action with the acting is a tribute to the best of what I love about an old movie story telling rarely seen in today's releases. I encourage all who enjoy a good storyline to see this movie as it is far more than a Godzilla movie, it's the birth of a new day in the franchise.

Yo...The Godzilla effects were out of this world. However; this movie was utterly trash. Honestly; I don't see how this movie is getting all the good reviews. What you get is 40 mins of trash followed by 30 seconds of Godzilla followed by another 50 mins of trash followed by 40 seconds of Godzilla. Rinse and repeat.
   The movie is mainly about some punk ass kamikaze pilot (understandably) who failed to oconduct his duty in WWII (love story included) and now seeks redemption by being a kamikaze pilot to kill Godzilla. He kind of failed at the kamikaze part again.
  I am a Godzilla fan but this mofo put my wife to sleep with me almost right behind her. I should have went to see the Marvels instead...F#$# this movie
Great movie! Loved the story!
It is a good movie and had good characters.  The movie had many good moments.
Greatest movie known to man onm🗣️🗣️🗣️
Way better then expected!

Almost certainly movie of the year. For the first time in a while, the human characters are ACTUALLY more compelling than the monster, and I mean that as a genuine compliment. Not to sleep on Godzilla himself, who is as fun as ever. Must see, for sure.
Not just the best Godzilla movie I've ever seen, one of the BEST movies I've ever seen! It's that good!! AMAZING!!

A cinematic masterpiece that’ll go down as probably one of if not the best Godzilla movie of all time. Character development was excellent and storyline was compelling and kept you interested the whole time. Coming from growing up watching the originally Godzilla and current and past movies. This is without a doubt in my top 3 if not top. Legendary and Warner Brothers take notes on how to make a proper film by watching this.

Great movie
Great storyline
Best Movie I've seen awhile hands down!

I'm telling you that this movie has earned every bit of praise it is getting.  A powerful a human drama. Not a war movie, a WWII story about survival in post apocalyptic Japan where their country lost everything and is back to "zero."  Not a monster movie, a monster story how the additional devastation from Godzilla took Japan down another notch from zero to "minus one."

I have seen all Godzilla movies (except for some animated ones). I saw the American version of Godzilla with Raymond Burr in the early 1960's. That's 50 years of reflection, all the good and the bad. My favorite is Gojira, but this movie has me rethinking that, perhaps for sentimental reasons, I'm not sure. Nevertheless, this has the best plot of any, Toho or otherwise. The characters are compelling, and Gojira (I prefer the Japanese name) is a frightening force of nature. Recommended 100%
Riveting. Godzilla is majestic in this film.  It's brilliant.
Solid movie, a real throwback to the original Godzilla movies so prevalent on Saturday afternoon TV growing up.
Amazing, slow in parts but this makes the peaks hit even harder.
I didn't realize it was a remake of the original but once I accepted that it was pretty good. The closed caption was easy to follow because sentences were short and to the point. Great action!
Whole storyline excellent  easy to follow great ending.
This was the best Japanese Godzilla film yet and I have watched them all. I grew up in the 70s.

I don't know how this movie got such a high rating, it was okay, not a bad movie but not great like the ratings have it. It was okay is what I'll describe as. It's okay. Not the best Godzilla movie, not the worst Godzilla movie, it's just okay.

The hype is real. If you grew up watching Godzilla movies then this is a no brainer. 
Twinges of nostalgia throughout the movie and as many people have said this one you actually care about the humans and their stories in this movie. How did they do such a good job with such a low budget when Disney and WB and the rest are putting out dog !+ time and time again with hundreds of millions of dollar budgets?
I loved it. Many have said its the best movie of the year. I have no argument against that opinion. Go see it!

Ive got to say Godzilla Minus One is a great and respectful retelling of the OG 1954 Godzilla film. The Creature effects were excellent. Great story. Wonderful actors.  Japanese with English subs. Definitely worth seeing.
another Godzilla masterpiece
Pretty good but a little thrown off by some pieces of this movie....but overall not bad...best Godzilla movie in a while before we do the King Kong thing
An ode to Japanese culture through & through.  The music, the story, I forgot film can be an art.  And what movie brought me this profound joy... a Godzilla movie.  Take some notes Hollywood.

Great watch! Really enjoyed the character development,  story , and found myself cheering for the main characters! Godzilla is very menacing and menancing. Best blast breath effect ever....Best godzilla move ever!!!
Incredible action thriller that everyone should see. Some of the acting can be slightly exaggerated, but that is just nitpicking a real gem of a movie.

This is a real throwback Godzilla movie, and not like the American versions of Godzilla. Almost like a remake of the original from way back in the day. Story is a little slow but characters have real depth to them. Godzilla parts are outstanding and well worth the price of admission.
It was great sounds and music alike original Godzilla movie loud a good monster movie

love this movie is a amazing Godzilla movie.
people with cellphone in theaters are a kind of downer. movie theater company should be more tight with the cellphone rules.
it was amazing seeing the g man in action as if was the 1954 movie, absolutely amazing and the CGI is peak, i literally have goo all over my screen just typing this, amazing movie 👍👍👍
Spectaculary Decieving, fun, wild, and real
One of the best ever from Toho.
Best godzilla movie after godzilla 1954 and best movie of the year
The best movie I've seen all year. From the first island scene you're taken away to a world beyond yours.
Best movie this year and the only Godzilla movie where the plot and characters are fantastic. Love it.

Best movie I've seen in a while, and my favorite this year! Take notes, Hollywood! This is how you not only make a good movie or in this case, a good Godzilla movie, but the story element and the human are relatable and grounded, not to mention the music really makes this film hit hard. And for a film with a budget of 15 million dollars that isn't overspend or overproduced or calling out fans to f off or hating them, it still looks outstanding while respecting their fanbase. 

It is rare nowadays to make me feel for human cast but they did, since it's set after the ww2 and it's them experience post war trauma, just like the original 1954 but with modern technology and take (and the good modern that isn't just there to pander to sacrifice story). The only problem I have is that this isn't in a lot of theaters for people to see it, because they would've loved this.

I recommend this film not only for Godzilla fans, but anyone who want to see an actual good movie with a well written story. If you have problem that your theater near you don't screen it, find a theater that has it and plan a trip just to see it. 

Or the safer rought is to wait until DVD or streaming, but only time will tell.
Certainly a great Godzilla movie, but a pretty solid movie too.

This was a perfect experience on big screen, the ost, vfx, plot, all in this movie is so divine and much more.

Thanks for all in this movie Takashi Yamasaki, this is an 10/10

What a great movie! The storyline was a little slow but the battle sequences with Godzilla absolutely made up for it. I am abog fan of the old Godzilla so this was right up my alley. Way better than any of the Hollywood Godzilla movies!

So refreshing to see rendition of Godzilla that hasn’t been overplayed. Great story arc of a Kamikaze pilot dealing with his own demons on top of a classic fan pleasing ending. Also, this had the most badass version of Godzillas heat ray I’ve seen to date.

Best movie of 2023 by far! Great story, great visual effects, with all the emotions you get in a fantastic movie. Reading the subtitles and following the movie was the easiest I've experienced in watching a foreign film.  I am definitely going to watch it again.

Absolutely Brilliant !!!  This is a very human story that just happens to have Godzilla in it.  The writing is spot on as are the performances, direction, cinematography,  costumes, and sound.  You will become involved in these characters.  The storyline will suck you in from the first frame and keep you involved till the end credits.  This is not your typical monster movie.  Go see this film while it's still in theaters.
10/10 way better than all the other godzilla movies. This is what they should strive for.
Live action anime. This was incredible to watch. The sound effects of his atomic attack is sick. Great story.
So good that I would have watched if Godzilla wasnt in it.
Im gonna need Minus Two
Amazing film, so much done with so little budget. the emotions of the actors and the impact of the effects really had impact.
One of the best Godzilla movies I've ever seen, the human story was engaging, and the cinematography was the better than any of the American Godzilla movies
if you are a fan of Godzilla, this a must see. The directing was top notch. Imagine that, humans adding to the storyline of a monster movie.
The best Godzilla movie since 1954

Wow, just wow. Wonderful, first Godzilla movie ever where I wanted the main characters to survive, the effects were breathtaking at points. The story telling was wonderful. The characters were perfectly developed, and the arc of the main character was one of the best I’ve ever seen. Every scene with Godzilla was treat, and absolutely epic. One of the best films of the year.
Love the graphics , the story line and overall the emotion the production  put in this movie is incredible.
Amazing. You come for Godzilla action and leave with a remarkable story with lovable characters. intense action, drama amd a powerful ending.
An excellent and deeply moving film. Possibly my favorite this year!
One of the best movies of the year ! Simply excellent. Must watch
I'm blown away. I can't remember the last time I saw something legitimately good in theaters.
Ive never been so invested in the story of a monster movie before.
Incredible visual effects despite the low budget. Godzilla Minus One exceeded my expectations with compelling character development, original music, and one ominous big fat monster!
Must see for all fans of the Godzilla franchise.

Incredible storytelling, the characters felt real and relatable even without a good understanding of the cultural nuances or historical significance. That is to say that even without the addition of Godzilla, the characters themselves convey a story of hopelessness, perseverance, and a truly human perspective on the world they are experiencing. More movies like these need to be made, and hopefully with the same passion and patience for storytelling.
Could watch this movie multiple times instant classic!!!

easily the most powerful movie I've watched all year. don't go in expecting cheesy popcorn mindless entertainment. this is not your typical monster movie blockbuster. it still has some riveting scenes and watching it in 4DX is definitely worth it!
Not what I expected but I loved it.
godzilla is a very cool monster
I loved the story, the graphics, and the roars were fantastic.
Best movie of 2023. Gripping story. Strong Characters. Must see if you like science fiction. You won’t be disappointed.

Godzilla minus 1 is some sort of heritage style B-movie. The character-driven film nods subtly in appreciation at Hollywood, while remaining an homage to mid-20th century Japanese popular cinema. I especially appreciate how the story tellers eschew reliance on special effects or the emotions fear, anger, and aggression to garner attention. Instead, they kept me engaged with charming characters, thoughtful costuming, and well-crafted mise en scène. A classic monster movie; and an 8 of 10 overall.
A beautifully filmed movie with stunning visuals and action sequences. This movie is a must see for both Godzilla lovers and those who are new to the franchise.

A great story about humanity, and finding purpose in the wake of tragedy, to make a better future. All wrapped up in compelling acting, great set design, and a beautifully terrifying monster. Cannot recommend this highly enough.

Poignant post-war story of life after tragedy. Classic Godzilla provides the symbolic challenge to overcome, illustrating the beast that persists after the trauma of war.  Courage, survival, found families and forgiveness triumph  in this latest take on an old favorite.
Beautiful film, good to see godzilla going back to its roots. I Can't fault this one, some of the best characters i have ever seen in film, and all equalliy likable and important.
A pleasure to see the King.
Great story. Stunning visuals. Classic score.
Surprisingly heartwarming with a fun plot!
If you are a fan of the 1954 original Godzilla film, you will love this film!!!

I thought it was a great movie.  However, in the beginning there is a place where the film slows down a bit for backstory and you have to get thru it to see all past that point.  If you make it past that point, it ramps up pretty quickly and continues being what we all love, Godzilla stomping the world...

In spite of an incredibly small budget (15 million) the film makers have managed to turn this movie into an instant classic. It's an emotional rollercoaster that had me rooting for humanity and that's no easy task these days. The special effects aren't great in some places, but when a movie is so well written they don't have to be. I would suggest Hollywood film makers head over to Japan at their earliest convenience and re-learn how to make movies that are cringe-free and watchable.
The nostalgia was heavy, so good. Even the human story was really good.

If this movie doesn't Win an Oscar, I quit cinema. Period.

This is not just a monster movie, this is a War Film. Pure perfection from start to finish, I just can't believe how good this film was. I got tears by the end of the film.

Absolutely outstanding.
I can't believe this movie made me cry. So much heart and brilliant ending.  Best random end of the year surprise of 2023.

Godzilla Minus One was superb. A great storyline with magnificent effects, lighting, sound, scale shots, camera angles, and realistic props. A perfect cast with a nostalgic and incredible score that really compliments the mood of the film. A heartfelt and emotional film that is captivating to someone who is not familiar with Godzilla, but a perfect film for the hardcore Godzilla fan. 10 out 10. A timeless masterpiece.

I brought my two sons to see this movie and all of us thoroughly enjoyed this movie. It was great to see a movie that had a great story and keep you invested with the characters. If you have a chance to see this movie, see it now. It's worth it.

I cried. The movie was really good. The human story was just a s captivating as the monsters story and how it all tied in together was magnificent!  I want a copy of this when it’s available. All of the actors were incredible.   The cinematography was awe inspiring. The only thing I didn’t like was Godzilla looked like he had thick chicken feet that just hurt when he walked. I know it was supposed to be dramatic effect but that part didn’t work for me but he’s still the scary colossal monster that we all know.  Great job!  I hope the story continues.
My favorite Godzilla movie
Has to be top 3 Godzilla movies I’ve ever seen
So much heart and action. A shockingly emotional and earnest film you’ll be surprised at how much you’ll experience watching a Godzilla film. Loved it!
Stunning! The story is so beautiful and heartbreaking and just epic! A true Godzilla masterpiece. A truly breathtaking movie.
Moving human stories with beautifully shot monster scenes. Great score. One of the best movies I've seen in years! Highly recommend

One of the best stories of the year. Some may not enjoy the subtitles, others may feel Godzilla was not needed to interrupt the incredible human story, but I enjoyed it. The first Godzilla in a decade where the human story was incredible. The struggle, the loss, the pain, the forgiveness, the hope, all of it...sensational!

Amazing dramatic scenes that drew you in to the characters and well timed action scenes. It felt realistic in a way past films missed not because of big budget, but good story, acting, and relatability.
Best Godzilla movie ever made. Engaging from start to finish. Great story. It offers a little of everything for everyone. Godzilla is not messing around this time. Two thumbs way up!
Can a Godzilla movie make you cry? Yes it can.
I can't believe I saw a Godzilla movie where I actually gave a fuck about the human characters.
I would never expect to tear up in a Godzilla movie! A must watch.

I've seen this film 3 times now taking different friends to see it. we all have loved it. it's a great character drama with compelling characters and arcs. Godzilla is a true monster and leaves you in awe and terror at his destruction. An amazing mix of powerful storytelling and monster horror/thriller
Kicks ass with a message

Simply a masterpiece, and in my opinion, the best Godzilla film ever made. In past Godzilla films, the human characters add minimally to the story, however in Minus One, the people's plot points are what drive the story. 

It excellently builds suspense, especially with the "Big-G" on screen. I will not go into any story spoilers, because you just HAVE to see it yourself. 

If you've been a fan for your whole life, or have never even heard of Godzilla, you will still love it. There is something for everyone. See it on the best and biggest screen possible. Absolutely worth the time!
It wasn't Godzilla.  He looks nothing like Godzilla
I loved the slight anime influence. Honestly, one of the best movies this year.
Great movie and well put together storyline.  Best Godzilla movie in the franchise.
Loved it! Best movie I've seen all year long. Great writing and action scenes.
Absolute thrill fest from start to finish. The first five minutes had chills shivering down my spine. A fun movie for casual viewers, and an amazing must-watch for Godzilla fans.

Real, heartfelt human characters.   Godzilla is a straight up terror.  Unlike most kaiju movies, you actually care about the people in danger.     A nice reset on what a Godzilla movie can and should be.
Great story and characters.

The surprise of the year.  I went into this expecting some good monster action, but the human side of this movie was incredible and really emotional and deep.  The movie could've worked on its own with any other villain substituting for Godzilla.  The human story was that good..... BUT Godzilla is as EPIC as he/she has ever been in this movie too.  The RT rating is true.  Go see this movie.... See this movie on the biggest screen yo can find!!!
Great movie all around! Good backstory, special effects, acting, and perfect length.
Not sure I got the purpose of this one. Ive watched all Godzilla movies. This was so unrealistic.
very good movie.  great story of redemption.
the movie is not in English, and I don't like to read the subtitles as the movie is going on, I will miss on what's going on in the movie to stop and read the subtitles all the time, so not for me !
Very well done.  Just like the classic Godzilla, only better made.
Wow wow wow go see it then youll get it

More than expected and it was the first time I was rooting for humanity to survive. They used reality type of trap that can destroy the monster. I admit I had a slight tear jerk from the overwhelming emotions it pulled out of me.

It was incredible. I was skeptical about watching a movie with subtitles not know Japanese, but it didn't affect the movie at all. It was everything you want in a Godzilla movie: suspenseful, scary, dramatic, emotional, funny, and extremely well done. Highly, highly recommend.

Godzilla Minus One is definitely a triumph masterpiece of destruction I like the 2014 American version of Godzilla but Minus One is really thrilling and really great human drama and the terror about the war and bombs and the vfx looks really outstanding and the sound is really fantastic.

The amount of times my jaw dropped, mouth wide open in the middle of the theatre… like wow. Insane film, the story line and character development was JUST as good as the action. I don’t know which I enjoyed more!! You’ll laugh, cry, smile, clutch your seat, all that. What a ride man I think I wanna go see it again! Can’t wait for the sequel heard it’s already confirmed! ***not a big deal at all, but only thing that through me off was when the toddler crying sounded like a newborn baby fresh out the wound 😂😂😂 if you watch you’ll see what I’m talking bout lol it just made me chuckle
Best movie of the year. Easily.

Really good acting by the Japanese cast.  Good story.  Was a throwback to the first few Toho Godzilla movies.  Tail swipe, thermonuclear blast, and, finally, they played the iconic Godzilla theme towards the end.  Best Godzilla movie since Godzilla v. Monster Zero.

Excellent take on the Big G! Retro and contemporary at the same time. Thoroughly enjoyed the story and the human characters. For once the humans are actually engaging and not just monster fodder, though many are stomped on by Godzilla! A must see!
Best Godzilla Movie to date
Loved the story and loved the action

I was a big Godzilla movie fan as a young boy but wouldn't have guessed that I would still be a fan 50 years later! This movie is great on so many levels and I won't spoil anything because it needs to be seen and experienced first hand on the big screen. Best Godzilla movie yet made! IMHO

Just watched Godzilla Minus 1 in 4DX at the Regal on Union Square 
Review
4DX-The seats rocked and rolled and threw me around like I was a twig . Steam  in your face and your feet get zapped.
It was a blast 
The movie without all the gizmos , so-so.
The last 20 minutes were really good.

People werent ready for the 4DX features, and the special effects kicked in their soda and popcorn went flying haha

My favorite movie of 2023. What they did with a 15M USD budget is phenomenal. 
It reminded me of my experience watching Top gun, sitting at the edge of my seat.

This is a perfect mix of characters you care for, Godzilla and action. 

Even as a non-Godzilla fan I would be surprised if you do not like it. It is just a great movie overall.

Watch it in the cinema if you can! And if you can, choose a theater with a great sound system!
An amazing movie. It had a plot and you are invested in the characters. It was worth it. I will be seeing it again.
Magnificent! The characters were actually more engrossing than Godzilla. Couple them with the amazing special effects and storyline and you a winner.
Absolutely fantastic! Loved every second of it, as a long time Godzilla fan this is everything I could have wanted! And it has actual good human characters.

Second only to the original Gojira (1954).  Thrilling, absorbing, and emotional throughout. This is also the most terrifying Godzilla (even scarier than Shin).  I've seen it three times and it just keeps getting better somehow.  SKREE-ONK!
Great melodramatic Japanese story, but only a few Godzilla appearances.
Outstanding character development and engaging story. This is a refreshing success in an otherwise disappointing year.
Best Godzilla movie I’ve ever seen
Surprisingly a really great film.

So much fun. The vintage feel and action sequences with the classic Godzilla score were amazing. Saw it 2 days ago in iMax and am already wanting to see it again! My only criticism was the ending—I think they could have gone different directions for better results.

in a year full of insanely expensive, shallow, and forgettable hollywood blockbusters, it's so exciting to see one that doesn't skip out on the great characters, impactful themes, strong acting and sharp writing. yes, this movie has great godzilla action - the effects, visuals, audio, and especially godzilla's design are all impressive, to the point that the movie is genuinely scary at times. but the humanity behind this movie is its biggest strength. thematically, i loved what the film says about how we find meaning in our lives, especially when tragedy strikes and we don't know where to go. the family dynamic is excellent and the camaraderie among the minesweeper crew make this movie a joy to watch, while koichi's journey dealing with ptsd and survivor's guilt give the movie a great emotional core. even side characters like the youngest member of the minesweeper crew, koichi's neighbor, and the mechanic have nuance.

this movie is proof to me that audiences aren't sick of blockbusters per se, but they're sick of bad, mediocre, and (as i said earlier) forgettable ones. this is certainly not one of them, and one of my favorites i've seen in a while.

This movie was good in delivering fun kaiju action, while also looking into the rebuilding of Japan post-WWII. It was filled with action, emotion, and feel good moments after hair raising displays of power by the titular Godzilla.
The movie resembled the older films of Godzilla. We rad the story then and we read it today. It was good.
I watched this yesterday with my Family. We all enjoyed this film. We all clapped and cheered at the end of the movie with everyone else! Must see and we will watch it again!

This movie was excellent. I saw it in screenx which definitely added to the cinematics and the overall experience. It definitely feels like a return to the older Godzilla movies where Godzilla is more of the villain. Overall definitely one of the best Godzilla movies to come out in recent years
The monster highlights the humanity needed to rebuild Japan, or any nation for that matter, after World War II. Surprisingly human for a monster movie.
Awesome movie good screen time balance between humans and monster
This movie was fantastic. The story was awesome. The cinematography was excellent. An emotional and epic rollercoaster.
The story was engaging and the characters were believable.  The monster himself was good!! Overall a great fun ride!
The greatest movie I have ever seen in my opinion is better than 1900s Godzilla
100 stars easy !!!!!
Bit over explanation combined with awkward Japanese acting was bit minus point for me, but overall story was good and action scenes were intense. Can't believe they made this 15M
I love the movie because I love Godzilla in this movie like this is the way first time in a long time that Godzilla is the villain I love this movie so much please make a part 2.

This movie is drama first and Godzilla movie second.  For the first time you get to like and root for the human characters in a monster flick.  Who would have thought you can give a good script to a movie in this genre?
Excellent film, maybe my favorite Godzilla.
Sweet, sensitive, heart warming and FUN!  Loved this film!

The story is amazing and I LOVE GODZILLA. The actors and actresses in this movie were phenomenal. I would have liked the monster to move more natural then robotic when. he walked into Gonzo, but still was amazing. And I am watching the movie again. Will the introduce Angriurs? I hope so! Next up Godzilla x Kong The New Empire can't wait! #godzillafan4life
Maybe the best Godzilla movie ever.  Spectacular special effects, plus a solid back story.  Even great music to back up some very suspenseful scenes.
Best film I've seen all year. Shows you don't need 500mil to make a phenomenal movie. Emotional, great takes on previous films, and overall well done.
A great monster flick. Classic Godzilla vibes and even cooler when seen on Screen X at the Marcus Ridge Cinema.
Best Godzilla ever!!! Great story
best movie of the year.  epic and amazing.
Engaging story + a killer Godzilla!

It doesn't matter if you're a Godzilla fan or not. It doesn't matter if you're slightly turned of by subtitles. The story, the pacing, the characters, the acting, the cinematography, the musical score, the special effects, and the direction all work in tandem to make this movie a hidden gem for western countries, and probably the best movie of the year.

This movie isn't just a monster movie. It's a human drama that tackles the questions of what happens to people when subjected to war, and tragedy on a grand scale. The movie tackles the questions of what it means to be a family, a nation, what is honor, and how to find redemption.

It's the only movie I've seen this year that left a lasting impression. It's been a week since I've seen it and I'm still thinking about it. Thanks to an extended theater run in North America, I will definitely view it again.

Certainly, an unexpected surprise.  This is a story of redemption with loads of emotion.  You'll see PTSD, guilt and grief during wartime.  The character development here was off the charts terrific, and arguably some of the best since, yes, the original Star Wars.  There wasn't one character in this movie that you didn't have some emotion tied to, really well done there.  

Obviously this is a Godzilla movie, however this is more of a character developmental story of our main protagonist.  This was really well done on all aspects.

My lone holdup, being a foreign movie, was the language barrier however, as long as you can read subtitles well, the emotion and communication with each scene was not an issue.

The story was great, but if I can find one minor issue with the movie would be that it should have kept some decisions rather than potentially sequel baiting or keeping the emotion tied to specific characters more permanent.  If you see it, you'll know what I'm talking about.  Elsewise, if you can consider this a standalone movie, this was great.

There have been many versions of the Godzilla mythology, but, in my opinion, Godzilla Minus One is one of the best I've seen. It's a Japanese-language film, and it's surprisingly explicit in its critique of various aspects of Japan's approach to its past history in wartime. It's commentary on war and nuclear power, symbolised by the post-war emergence of Godzilla, is powerful. And the themes of loss, survival, and hope add emotional depth.

The story focuses primarily on Sosaku Tachibana, a fighter pilot, who has managed to avoid his fate as a kamikaze pilot by avoiding action altogether. At one point in the film, it is noticed that his plane hasn't been damaged. The guilt of not fulfilling his orders, including not defending his colleagues against Godzilla early in the story, haunts him, and his internal struggles with this are constantly present as the story unfolds.

The other characters are also well-developed and very relatable, bringing a sense of stability in the middle of the chaos. This adds a deeply human element to the story, which focuses more on the humans than the action and special effects, giving us a reason to empathise with and care about these characters rather than just seeking the thrills that come with this genre.

Having said that, though, the visual effects in Godzilla Minus One are stunning and bring Godzilla, a very intimidating monster, to life with realism and fine detail. And the action sequences are intense and exciting. Godzilla really feels powerful and destructive as it goes on its rampages.

Some viewers may find the plot a bit predictable. But the Godzilla mythology is well-embedded among many filmgoers, so that may increase the sense of predictability. And occasionally, it is obvious that CGI has been used, so there are moments when things seem a bit artificial. And there is not much humour to lighten the relentless sadness and fear of the storyline.

If you are a fan of monster movies and action films, and especially of the Godzilla story, go and see Godzilla Minus One. It delivers what it promises when it comes to spectacular visuals and intense action. The explicit exploration of themes of war and loss is handled well.

Bit of a slow start imo, but once you get through it and start to actually build attachment to the characters and their storylines you get engulfed in this thrilling plot that invokes a plethora of emotions from fear and sadness all the way to duty and patriotism. A great execution that goes beyond the scope of its predecessors and touches on deep rooted topics of Japanese 20th century culture and the effects that war had on both the mind and body of the country and its people. Haven't sat on it for too long yet, but as of right now it stands as my favorite rendition of the franchise ever.
it was phenomenal and worth every moment spent watching it
The best Godzilla movie Ive ever seen. Honestly my top movie I have seen all year. It was so refreshing good i cant wait to see if they will make another.

This really is one of and possibly the best Godzilla movie ever made. This is not your save the Earth Godzilla, this is a murderous, rampaging, beast of destruction. The visuals and affects are amazing. The sound is amazing. The story and acting are amazing. You really need to go out and see this in the theater. To make this movie on the budget they had is incredible. It stands up to anything Hollywood could make with 20 times the money. The story is well told, emotional, full of surprises and twists. I've just returned home from my first viewing, and I can't wait to share my thoughts. The story follows a veteran of war as he overcomes survivors guilt and realizes through his found family and Japan's new struggle against Godzilla his life has meaning and the importance of mankind's persistence in the face of adversity. TOHO proves less is more by returning Godzilla to his antagonistic roots as a standalone terror with its eyes set on Japan. No other monsters needed. A worthy and wonderful franchise entry by writer/director Takashi Yamazaki. The film paves the way for a bright future of TOHO Godzilla content. The pacing of the film can be a little inconsistent at times, however this hardly detracts from the glorious monster action and touching human storyline that make "Godzilla Minus One" one of the greatest entries in the franchise to date. Coming in at #3 on my list of all time favorite Godzilla movies, I happily give it a 4.5/5!

Godzilla minus one brings back the routes of the atomic horror that is Godzilla but with a different perspective. Unlike 54 which focuses on the effects of nuclear warfare and shin which focuses more on the critique of the many restrictions Japan has against threats, Shin focuses on the main character heavily with heavy messaging of regret, trauma, and how some may overcome it as well as how it always lurks within us with Godzilla being the symbol of that. A beautiful story that will forever resonate with us like 1954.

This is not just an excellent Godzilla movie, but also an incredible take on a WWII movie.

The story of how a kamikaze pilot comes with "failing" his mission, coming home to be called a coward and "the reason the Axis lost the war".

Then finding a reason to live, and a purpose beyond just war.

It also expands the Godzilla mythos in a new and interesting way.

This is, easily, the best film of the franchise, and I'm hoping present and future screenwriters took notes.

To make the title character not the star was a bold move, but it paid off. The storytelling of Japan regrouping from WWII and the human condition is so phenomenal and compelling that, at one point, I forgot I was watching a Godzilla movie, but that's a TOHO for you.

I can't wait for a sequel. I need a sequel.

Even if you took the Big Guy out, it would be an amazing period piece about immediate postwar Japan (1945 to 1947, the original was set in 1954 after Japan was starting to rebuild), the devastation of Tokyo, and survivors guilt, without excusing Japan's wartime actions. And then they made Godzilla the most horrifying he's ever been, while scaling him back down to the original movie size. He's not so big humans are beneath his notice, he notices and absolutely hates them. It's an excellent drama. It's an excellent horror movie. And it's an excellent Godzilla monster movie. Highly recommend.
Maybe best Godzilla movie of the all. One part Kaiju, one part Ozu.

What a great job by the screen writers.   Finally a monster movie where the monster is not buddies with some scientists or secretly in love with a human  (King Kong ice skating in Central park was about as silly as it gets in any movie ever).   The writers actually let a monster be scary and not have a "soft" spot for the puny humans.  The story was also thought provoking as well given the history of Japan for individual self sacrifice and questions about what a country should expect from the citizens.  This is not just a movie for monster movie junkies.  Hollywood should take notes on how it should be done.  One question.  How did they make that little girl cry on cue?   She is too young to take direction and those were some real tears.  Maybe I don't want to know....

This is what movies should be. A perfect blend between spectacle and story! This is a film that not only takes Godzilla back to his roots as a post-war allegory but expands upon those ideas in beautiful and unexpected ways. Godzilla Minus One is such a compelling human drama that it would still be a fantastic movie without Godzilla even being present, and yet we are blessed with some of the most incredible and thrilling Godzilla-monster action we have seen to date! After 5 viewings, the film is still incredibly impactful and resonant. I love it!

It is amazing to think that a 70 year old movie franchise has delivered us the best Feature in it's long run since the 1954 Original. This is the movie that I have waited for, a serious dramatic "what if" that treats every aspect of the situation seriously. The acting is top shelf, the effects are on-point (save a few dodgy shots of boats in the water, but all is forgiven when Goji appears) and the script...THE SCRIPT!!! 

It should be a no brainer but having a great script to tie all the Monster Mayhem together and make us FEEL for the characters is exactly the ticket.

I've seen the movie three times now, and each screening's audience has been bigger than the last.

Long Live The King!!

Its a remake of the original, but pulls in elements from all eras of the franchise. The originals plot beats, Monster Island, Ghidorah's creation plot, and Legendaries animations.
Best movie I watched in 2023. Will definitely watch again or own it if on iTunes for purchase.

It was nice that Toho didn't personify Godzilla Minus One like Legendary has in the monsterverse version. This movie was about a giant monster with an animal instinct trying to destroy/kill people, not a bumbling sentient being with a sense of humanity at its core. 
By definition, a monster is frightening and Godzilla Minus One was just that. The monsterverse Godzilla is sort of a savior to humanity. Legendary's version fights ill intended creatures and any sort of damage is collateral whereas Minus One is hell bent on destruction.
I enjoy both of them but I prefer the mean Toho Godzilla (Minus One) over the tame Legendary Godzilla. I've seen all of the G movies though the decades, this one is (IMO) by far, the best.

The CGI is the only noteworthy aspect of this film. This movie lacks complexity. The personality of the characters are under developed so it was difficult to feel any emotion for their tragedies or triumphs. The scenes in which Godzilla is causing destruction are short lived and were not dramatic enough to leave a lasting impression. Overall a very lackluster movie.

Taking it back to its roots but with an unbelievable focus on the resilient human spirit. Incredibly well written with massive VFX & suspenseful battles. The sound editing emphasizes the emotional impact.

A modern day masterpiece! I do not often recommend movies but I would recommend this one! It was one of those movies where it can be described as “perfect” or even “near perfect”. The last movie that impacted me so strongly after I left was Infinity War by Marvel Studios… Godzilla Minus One puts Hollywood to shame!

Extraordinary. The building of characters in a Godzilla movie low key kinda sounds far fetched. But the character arks are absolutely flawless and you want every person to triumph. The Godzilla monster was absolutely stunning visually. Can’t recommend this roller coaster of emotions in a Godzilla movie enough.

Other than the truly outstanding and perhaps unprecedented special effects, this is a VERY BAD film made by morons. Absolutely CRINGEWORTHY acting, script, story line. I've never seen more horrible actors in one film. Do not believe the hype. Think for yourselves. I seriously question the authenticity of the ENDLESS five star reviews all saying the same thing. I believe the entire Japanese cast and production team posted rave reviews for their own film with the help of Google translate. You've been warned. Proceed at your own risk. Prepare to cringe like never before. The film is a MESS. I left thinking, "What did I just watch?" I wanted to like it, but they all let me down. Kudos to the monster design and SFX brilliant team.

What a great movie.  Do not let the subtitles stop you from seeing this movie.  They do not get in the way at all.  This is by far the best Godzilla movie ever and isn't like the cheesie ones before this.

Yes, it is true, this is the first ever Godzilla movie I have ever seen, and oh my god, what a f***ing fantastic movie. I did not expect to love this movie at this level. This was honestly a spur of the moment movie for me. I'd seen everyone talking about this movie, the amazing ratings, so I booked a ticket, which I actually got for free, and man oh man this was so worth using my free ticket. Everything about this movie was amazing. From the very beginning of the movie I was just hooked. I had no idea what to expect throughout the entire movie, it kept me on the edge of my seat the entire time. I don't know if this story is another repeat of previous Godzilla films or not, but all I'm going to say is that the story is fantastic, so well written. The line delivery from the cast was amazing, those performances, top tier. The score, the cinematography, the visuals, all of them just top tier, especially for a movie about Godzilla. Overall this movie was amazing, I loved it, easily one of the best 2023 movies and I would easily nominate this movie for the Oscar of Best International Film, no question there.

Just saw it tonight with my neice. I grew up on the old heisei godzillas, then ADORED the monsterverse made by legendary, and this movie is just a sublime mix of both (largely heisei). The use of the original godzilla themes was nostalgic but not cringey, and the terror I felt for the characters was great. A godzilla movie made me elated for its human characters. That's incredible!
I liked this take on this movie.
Best Godzilla film!!!
BEST GODZILLA FILM EVER!

Godzilla Minus One, is a great addition to the Godzilla franchise a contrast to WB's Godzilla films. This is very reminiscent of the early Godzilla films. I would say the writing is phenomenal and beautifully written. The CG is a little lacking and Godzilla is a bit stiff but the story and acting are fantastic. I would say it is worth seeing if you are a fan of Godzilla or just a good story.

I have two Godzilla Tattoo's, 4 Movie posters, 4 original set photos signed by the original cast, have over 20 Godzilla art pieces so I believe I have a good opinion when it comes to Godzilla films. This film is the best over the last 70 years. It is an absolute must see. Act 2 does get a little slow for my liking but the pacing allows you to like the characters even more. Usually I root for Godzilla this movie made me flip. Best human Characters in a Godzilla film. Which makes the ending that much more sweet.  Should be Awarded best foreign film.
The movie is epic in so many ways. Godzilla looks amazing. The story is riveting. The soundtrack is awesome. Definitely see this on the big screen

THE TERROR. THE SORROW. THE DESTRUCTION. THE CRYING. Easily top 5 Godzilla movie, and honestly this probably tops my personal list. Bringing Godzilla back to basics, he’s the King of Monsters yes, but he’s the embodiment of pure chaos. Takashi Yamazaki brings the original Kaiju back to basics, at Godzillas core, it is the catalyst of destruction, it ruins peoples lives, the macabre of everyone’s fear, something unpredictable and uncontrollable. I love it. As much as Americans want to heroize the King of Monsters, at the end of the day Godzilla is a force of destructive nature that unapologetically reeks terror on the land. With that depiction of Godzilla done correctly like it is here, you’re not going to have anything less of a top tier Godzilla cinematic experience. What adds on to greatness of this film, is the powerful story. Yes this is yet another retelling of the origin, but the film grounds you with the people, you know they have survived a terrible event of biblical proportions, you feel for them, you feel their trauma. It shows the perseverance of man and your chosen family. This film even manages to squeeze in some laughs, in terms of range and tone, everything is perfectly balanced in my opinion. The actors are great in showing their trauma, love, and fear. Great cast all around. The cgi is stunning, they went with the modern Godzilla look but succeed in showing the battle damage he endures, the close up shots are mega detailed, the attention to detail for the in sea shots are amazing, but what takes the cake is the atomic breathe, in recent memory I can’t remember Godzilla’s beam being that damn disastrous. Along with an awesome soundtrack (and the euphoria of hearing Godzilla’s theme at THE MOST appropriate times) the cinematography is easily the best in any of the live action Godzilla movies (even better than GvK which is fantastic in it’s own right). If you’re a Godzilla fan, or even just a movie monster fan, you have no reason to check this movie out. It checks all the boxes and then some in terms of what makes Godzilla great.

This movie completely 💩 one all of Hollywood’s blockbuster’s released this year. It’s big, intense, and exciting despite the 15 million budget while also being emotional with characters you care about. WATCH THIS MOVIE!

BEST MOVIE of the YEAR!  WOW!  SO different.  Did not expect a serious and super realistic new take on the old Godzilla story.  Great cinematography!
And the depiction of the Japanese, recently defeated in WW2, seemed very true.  Best Godzilla movie ever.  And I had grown weary of them so did not expect this gem.  The almost unanimous 99% reviews, by movie critics and general audience, were surprising, but turned out well deserved.  
It has English Subtitles, so be prepared for some reading, no problem if you speak Japanese.   
Saw it 12.5.23, at 'lertn AMC.  
Givin it max  5 stars.
Might see it again.... and again.

This movie did a great job on showing the unity and heart of people coming together defend themselves in a common enemy. Godzilla is a villain that has no mercy in this film and you see how his destruction affects the people in his path. The ending of the film had me feeling emotional, excited, and thrilled. Overall the film was really great!

The movie was amazing, the best Godzilla movie to date. The acting was amazing, and the story was great. It was great to hear Godzilla's theme music used to perfection it really helped highlight certain emotions in scenes. It's nice to see the Japanese still know how to make a great movie. Hollywood should take notes and stop putting out the same predictable, woke, garbage over and over. Godzilla 10/10.
Best Godzilla movie ever! Refreshing! Full of emotion.
Back to the classic formula only with a much more frightening G!

Godzilla Minus One takes the focus away from the giant monster, and shows us the value of human life. Having just the right amount of giant lizard, this film is a beautiful marriage of classic Godzilla horror with a new and refreshing take.
The story holds your attention the entire time! The action is compelling and the characters are both relatable and respectable in a way that is truly stunning you'll be actively rooting for them.
An excellent, moving story with it without Godzilla.  But Godzilla himself is extremely impressive and genuinely frightening and awe inspiring.

It slowed some, but it was very good to watch, monster, war, drama, love story, revenge...a little of everything! Yes- close captioned works against typical theater, still a good movie, the idiots who give it 0 or 1 star--- Yet refuse to watch it until English dubbed are low IQ

This is hands down the best movie Ive seen all year. Best in a long time. The story and characters are so compelling. I was drawn in right away and loved the acting. So many great performances. It felt like an old classic at times. I was blown away. Really really well done!
First timers be warned it’s a beautiful callback to the classics.
A great character-driven monster movie!
Great movie, felt like I was 12 years old on a Saturday afternoon.

Great filmmaking and strong, committed cast.  It's Godzilla 1947 Japan, a period piece with AAA period detail thruout.  It's also Godzilla-noir; The main character struggles over and over with survivor guilt from WWII.  It's nothing like the more up-beat, Westernized Legendary Godzilla with the Monarch over-story.  Where the Monarch Godzilla is more dramatic and imaginative, Godzilla 1947 is more about honoring Godzilla as an artistic Japanese creation.  At the end, after Godzilla's takedown, all the sailors salute Godzilla.  

It's great filmmaking; the script took three years to write.  The inevitable Godzilla takedown is a collaborative effort of de-commissioned Japanese naval sailors, a voluntary group of citizens working against impossible odds.  (An even greater, positive, collaborative group effort can be seen in the great Chinese film, The Wandering Earth (Netflix).  The script took three years to write.  It's basically a non-ironic re-make of Godzilla (1954) re-imagined with better plot, better human characters and better VFX. 

It's too long (124 mins).  Cutting 20-25 minutes would have helped it do better at the box office.  It's also a Toho film 

Washington Post:  "Top Gun Maverick and this Godzilla show us there's an audience for movies which combine concise and creative action with emotionally resonant human characters."  Yes as in the best of the Legendary Monarch Godzillas, the balance also works here.

Film Stage:  "It's willing to stay in the quiet anguish of several characters for uncomfortable lengths of time so the ultimate release is all the sweeter."

Empire:  "A refreshingly humanist and nostalgic reboot of the iconic monster franchise, Takashi Yamazaki's Godzilla Minus One takes the atomic lizard back to his post-war roots, while making the most of the director's background in animation and VFX direction through convincing, tactile and classic design work."
This movie had such an amazing story, which had me crying at times! Godzilla was absolutely terrifying I think this might be the best one ever made!

Everything in this movie works perfectly. Takashi Yamasaki's cinematography is astonishing and memorizing. Kamiki Ryunosuke's acting is truly worthy of an Oscar as you can feel the intensity and emotion in his character. Godzilla is one of, if not the best antagonist in 2023 as Godzilla leaves no mercy for anyone. The only issue that I had was the fact that since it was made in Japan, the movie needed subtitles to translate it into English and the translations distracted me from being able to fully watch everything around the film. Overall though, it is a great film that has some of the best conflict and possibly the best third act ever.

About as good as I think you can make a Godzilla movie.  Extremely Japanese, and my Japanese wife who's never seen a Godzilla movie in her life loved it.  I also loved it.  I don't think you have to understand Japanese culture or have seen past Godzilla movies to appreciate it, but it likely helps.
great movie.  subtitles didn't bother me at all.  really loved the character development.

Unbelievable how great this movie is! Most of the time (looking at you, Hollywood), we could care less about the human characters in monster/Godzilla movies; however, "Godzilla Minus One," gives us characters to root for and a monster that is truly scary and fearsome. I don't want to spoil it, so I'll just say GO SEE IT IN A MOVIE THEATER NOW!!?
The best Godzilla movie to date and of 2023!

I didn't like this movie. I LOVED IT! Story lines have now improved in the Godzilla franchise. Shows you can have a Godzilla movie without Godzilla there all the time. Not for the ones who don't have an attention span.

A very pleasant surprise for a monster movie indeed, from the fantastic acting to the special effects this is one of the best movies I've seen this year! The only down side to this movie is that the second half drags a bit but overall this movie delivers, a must go see in theaters for sure!

Godzilla Minus One is the clearest example of how to make a beautiful film with a small budget. Could be a lock for the Visual Effects Oscar. The story is balanced, and the characters are real enough to root for. The simple film is straight forward and back to basics which is why it works overall. This is what great films look like.
Whoa! How is a Godzilla movie this good?!? Incredible. Run don't walk, for sure. Theater experience of the year.

Went to the Imax to see it....very very good Godzilla movie. Excellent effects and a great human storyline to boot!
Better than so many other wannabee Godzilla movies!!!

An absolute masterpiece! With gripping characters and a terrifying Godzilla, all wrapped up in a powerful story about redemption, the sanctity of life and the triumph of the human spirit, Minus One is easily among the best entries in the franchise as well as the entire kaiju genre.
It was probably the best Godzilla movie ever made. It reminded me of being a kid in the 70s watching the old B&W Godzilla movies on Saturday afternoons.
I liked their use of the original music from the original 1st GODZILLA in 1954! Godzilla ended up being everything he was before but clearer & meaner! Well done, guys...didnt disappoint!👏👍💚
Very human story. Not typical big monster schlock.
Absolutely amazing, so much emotion.
Please make more of these

Masterpiece is literally an understatement…. I've never been a huge fan of Godzilla but this movie absolutely changed my mind. I will be showing my children this movie when they get older. There was nothing they could've added or taken away to make this movie any better….. wow just wow.
instant classic, right up there with the original 1954 masterpiece (love the ode to 1956 american version with the newscasters)  everything you want from a classic Godzilla film

One part Jurassic Park, one part Jaws, one part Oppenheimer, one part Dunkirk. This is an outstanding movie that will have you emotionally invested into it. The characters you are rooting for their success and well being. Godzilla is scary and a real threat in this movie. Music score if phenomenal, building tension and seriousness with the absent of music at times. Must see movie in the biggest theater with a good sound system.

Perfect encapsulation of the allegory that is Godzilla. Nothing Legendary has done has made me care for the human characters. This movie made me care by making the human drama and the lessons hidden there in the focus of the film. In a time when too many movies are focusing on CGI over storytelling, this film is a standout masterpiece.
Stunning and magnificent. A really great storyline that is entrancing,  which is more about post- WWII Japan than about Godzilla. I loved it!
Godzilla fans are eating good lately and I'm loving it
Best movie of the year and best Godzilla to date

Loved this movie.  Simple but really good and emotional story.  Didn’t think I’d get that in a Godzilla movie but I really enjoyed it.  The right amount of Godzilla in the movie and he was the terrifying monster he’s supposed to be.
Dark, Intense, Awesome.

This movie is pretty good and the Godzilla in this one is scary.
Almost the best Godzilla movie after the original 1954 Gojira and about equal to 2016's Shin Gojira. Blows all the others away, including ALL of Legendary's 'Monsterverse' offerings!

I came out of the movie theater thinking WOW. This movie is the first Godzilla movie that has focused on the heart and the plot of the story instead of the action and special effects, I wouldn't change a thing about the plot. The movie also has a sense of redemption both for the characters and world war 2 Japanese culture. This movie is JAWS with Japanese soldiers. Even though the ending was slightly predictable and the C.G.I. of the Godzilla was a little sketchy at times, I was still impressed. This movie is very sad and intense. There were some scenes where my heart was pounding and my fingernails were digging into my legs. I think that this is a great movie; must see!

I was thoroughly impressed and moved by this movie and the acting. It leaves you with an emotional attachment to the characters which makes it so great. I won’t be surprised if it gets nominated for something big.

I thought it would be a good movie, and then it was 10x better than what I anticipated! I really hope they make a sequel and I hope this goes to streaming soon so I can watch it over and over! Definitely a must watch, best film of 2023 by far!

Muy buena película, se mantiene los aspectos oscuros y históricos de este gran personaje, la historia esta muy hecha sin dejar de lado la temática del terror que es ver a Godzilla....Buena película si se las recomiendo ver mas de 1 vez.

Fellow movie goers, BEWARE. This redundant addition to the Godzilla franchise is one of the worst movies I've ever seen recommended by RT and I'm afraid there might be some kind of shady action here. I can't imagine anyone not insulted by this hot mess. Where I can see benefits from this movie is teaching aspiring film students what NOT to do. Let's start at the beginning. Unlike its cousin the surreal RODAN (1956), Yamazaki breaks the first rule of monster moviemaking by showing him in the opening scene. In the same scene, the hero gets a chance to fire a 40 mm gun at Big G, but doesn't. Why? After this 10-minute scene we get a lot of "who cares" screenwriting, trying desperately to bring human gravity to what is essentially an over-the-top thrill ride MONSTER MOVIE. Really? Seeing a movie like this makes one appreciate Spielberg's human touch in his classic "Jaws." All the scenes are too long, ploddingly paced and the screenwriting is cliche, boring and wildly predictable. The film looks like it's been blown up from 16 mm and the special effects still make Big G look like a guy in a rubber suit. Aside from names like Kurosawa and Ozu, maybe Japan should stick to building great cars and leave the monster genre to the young at heart.

The best modern day Godzilla to date, reall hard to fathom that it had a $15 million budget. The story is very well done with historical context thrown in. They do a great job with making you emotionally invested In the characters, and obviously Godzilla. He's also the most powerful and ruthless Godzilla we've ever seen!!!
I heard really good things but I didn’t expect this movie to be so amazing! Great story and fantastic acting and directing!
Best Godzilla movie ever made the VFX WAS AMAZING the shots at Godzilla in water amazing the human storyline amazing we need more Godzilla Toho films every 3-4 years I give it a rating 10/10

Possibly the scariest Godzilla monster, ever.  The human drama was compelling in the beginning but turned into a long painful slog toward by the end.  Seriously, Koichi's ham-handed ugly crying near the end made me want to puke, as did a couple of the act three plot twists.  The scenes with the monster though are pretty great, especially the attack on Tokyo.  It was *brilliant* to bring the original music back, that was a great touch.  One question though?  Why do they continue making Godzilla's head so small now?  He looks like a gym-bunny, all roided out.  Part of what makes G so scary, to me at least, is his intelligence.  Give the big lizard a more representative head size!

I've seen a lot of Godzilla movies since I was a kid from the bad to the horribly good to the great. This is a great popcorn movie with some very good Godzilla scenes in it. This is still a monster movie so what the audience is mainly salivating for is good CGI lots of good scary monster shots, lots of destruction and getting strong/decent human characters is just a plus so I think this movie checked all the boxes. 👍👍

Please make sure you see this movie. It will be a travesty if this movie doesn't have multiple Oscar nominations. Best Picture and Best Foreign Film, at a minimum. The Writing is exceptional, The Acting beyond professional, the special effects were exactly what this 70 year series needed. Take your teenagers to this movie and introduce them to the original (OG) Kaiju.

A Refreshing Take on the Kaiju Genre

Unlike recent Hollywood Godzilla films, which often prioritize spectacle over substance, Godzilla Minus One takes a more grounded approach. The film is set in post-war Japan, a time of great hardship and uncertainty. Godzilla's arrival is not just a disaster, but also a symbol of the nation's trauma and resilience.

This focus on human drama elevates the film above your average monster movie. The characters are well-developed and relatable, and their struggles are genuinely affecting. We see the impact of Godzilla's destruction on their lives, both physically and emotionally.
The first Godzilla that made me care about the humans more than the monster.  Added points for the WW2 tech accuracy, Takao, Yukikaze, Hibiki and J7W reveal :D
Just finished watching Godzilla Minus One.  This movie is so good that I felt compelled to sign up with Rotten tomatoes to provide a 5 stars rating reviews. A good story well told.
This film was amazing 100/10 so film is the greatest godzilla film on them planet better then the American films. godzilla minus one has amazing VFX and Cgi and it is truly a film to watch!!
Raw,Primal and Agonizingly Brilliant!

Great take on the King of Monsters. Really explores the metaphorical love-hate relationship the Japanese have with Godzilla. The most touching and moving of the entire franchise. The setting in post -war Japan is spectacular and adds a special context to story. Great to see in original version as seen in Japan!
Saw this movie 2 times in a Regal RPX screen.  This is in my top favorites list of 2023.  Such a good movie.  Thank you Toho.
So much more than a simple Godzilla movie. Ran me through the emotional roller coaster and I loved every minute of it.
Loved this one. Best Godzilla movie I've ever seen. I've seen all of them. Full Japanese cast with subtitles, no English, but just emotive and expressive in their performances.
Best Godzilla movie ever made. You will cry and you will be in awe of this movie. GO WATCH.

What a glorious return of live-action Godzilla to the hands of actual Japanese filmmakers. This film is about so much more than Godzilla, using the aftermath of WWII as a powerful backdrop and exploring deeply personal and emotional moments with our small cast of characters. It's got the action and the beautiful, jaw-dropping destruction you'd expect from our kaiju friend, but it doesn't get so caught up in the fanfare that it loses touch. The CGI, while not quite seamless, is incredibly impressive given the film's tiny budget. Some of the acting and dialogue are a little over the top for my taste, but it's definitely a bit of a cultural thing. Overall, this is a great return or introduction to Godzilla for anyone who loves a great story, beautifully written characters, and a little monster mashing.
Great Godzilla movie, I haven't been to theaters in a while but this movie made me go back and it was worth it.
What an amazing movie 💯
Love the action and suspense and story line.

Much like Shin Godzilla before it, Godzilla Minus One seeks a return to the solo-monster horror roots of the franchise. While Shin Godzilla served as a critique of a bureaucracy unable to respond adequately to crisis, Minus One aims for a more personal story of survivor's guilt and trauma, and pulls it off exceptionally well. 

Godzilla, being so large, steals the screen whenever it's around, and its mere presence is enough to cause catastrophic loss of life without it even intending such devastation. Once again a manifestation of the horror of atomic warfare, the creature is once again re-imagined, and doesn't suffer for having a lesser height than its American counterpart.

All in all, Godzilla Minus One elevates itself above being "just" a giant monster movie, and manages to craft a touching and dramatic personal story amidst a country struggling with its identity.
Best Godzilla movie ever 👍🏼👍🏼

I've loved Godzilla movies since I was a kid.  The recent US adaptations were entertaining but still lacked something that made the original 1954 movie so effective.  This movie captures the magic of the original and then some.  Behind the special effects and musical score is a great story and character development.  You begin to feel for the characters as they try to adjust to post-war life and deal with the appearance of a giant monster.  This makes Godzilla more "scary" because you see it from the perspective of the people.  It feels a bit more like a horror movie than the US monster-verse movies.

"Godzilla Minus One" is a riveting and captivating film that redefines the boundaries of the classic monster genre. This cinematic masterpiece, directed by visionary filmmakers, seamlessly blends cutting-edge CGI with a compelling narrative, delivering an unforgettable experience for both die-hard fans and newcomers alike.

The movie sets a new standard for storytelling within the monster universe, skillfully crafting a storyline that delves deep into the emotional core of its characters while maintaining the awe-inspiring spectacle of colossal creatures battling it out on the big screen. The character development is exceptional, offering a poignant exploration of humanity's resilience in the face of unimaginable devastation.

One of the most striking aspects of "Godzilla Minus One" is its breathtaking visual effects. The meticulous attention to detail in bringing these legendary monsters to life is nothing short of astonishing. Every roar, every thunderous footstep, and every destructive clash between titans feels incredibly realistic, immersing the audience into the heart of the action.

Moreover, the film's musical score deserves immense praise for enhancing the overall atmosphere and intensifying the emotional impact of each scene. The soundtrack perfectly complements the on-screen spectacle, creating a symphony of epic proportions that resonates long after the credits roll.

In addition to its technical brilliance, "Godzilla Minus One" successfully balances adrenaline-pumping action sequences with moments of genuine depth and introspection. It explores themes of sacrifice, bravery, and the indomitable human spirit, making it a thought-provoking and emotionally resonant cinematic journey.

Overall, "Godzilla Minus One" is a tour de force in the realm of monster movies, setting a new benchmark for the genre. With its breathtaking visuals, compelling storytelling, and powerful performances, this film is an absolute must-watch that will leave audiences exhilarated and moved in equal measure.
It's a good old Godzilla film by Toho. Solid acting and solid action.
Sleeper!!! Awesome period maybe the best Godzilla movie ever!!

You absolutely NEED to see this movie it was absolutely the best thing I've watched in the last 5 years, the action sequences are spectacular and the soundtrack is truly goodly YOU JUST HAVE TO SEE THIS MOOVIE
